title: How to Make Mixed Nut Toffee Tart

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350ºF, 180ºC, or gas mark 4.
Prepare the crust.
steps.description:
Lay the shortcrust pastry over the tart tin and carefully press it down while molding it around the tin with your fingers, ensuring that it overlaps the sides by 0.19"/⁄2 centimeter (0.2 in). {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/56/Toffeetart4.png/456px-Toffeetart4.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/5/56/Toffeetart4.png/220px-Toffeetart4.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":117,"bigWidth":"220","bigHeight":"56","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart

"}Press down around the edges with your fingers. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/f1/Toffeetart5.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/f/f1/Toffeetart5.png/220px-Toffeetart5.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":422,"bigWidth":"220","bigHeight":"202","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart

"}Then carefully tear off the excess crust that hangs off. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/99/Toffeetart6.png/459px-Toffeetart6.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/9/99/Toffeetart6.png/222px-Toffeetart6.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":197,"bigWidth":"222","bigHeight":"95","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart

"}Use a fork to gently make holes on the bottom of the dough. This makes sure that the pastry doesn't rise while in the oven.

steps.headline: Blind bake the pastry.
steps.description:
Take the parchment paper and place it over the crust tin. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/3d\/Toffeetart8.png","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/3\/3d\/Toffeetart8.png\/220px-Toffeetart8.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":284,"bigWidth":"220","bigHeight":"136","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
Details: http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}Pour the beans into the tin. The beans help to weigh down the pastry. Note that the dough is much better if it is cold before baking. Place the filled tin in the fridge or freezer for a few minutes to cool before baking. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/fc\/Toffeetart9.png\/460px-Toffeetart9.png","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/f\/fc\/Toffeetart9.png\/220px-Toffeetart9.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":220,"bigWidth":"220","bigHeight":"105","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
Details: http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}Bake the crust for 20 to 25 minutes. Place it in the center of the oven. Remove from the oven when it's a light golden brown color.

steps.headline: Prepare the toffee and nut filling.
steps.description:
Place a pan on a medium heat. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/6/69/Toffeetart11.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/6/69/Toffeetart11.png/220px-Toffeetart11.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":332,"bigWidth":"220","bigHeight":"159","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart

"}Add the sugar to the pan and let it caramelize. When it begins the caramelizing process, stir the sugar with a wooden spoon to avoid any burning in one spot. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/1/15/Toffeetart12.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/1/15/Toffeetart12.png/221px-Toffeetart12.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":329,"bigWidth":"221","bigHeight":"158","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart

"}As soon as the sugar has caramelized, carefully add the butter - avoid getting splashed and continue to stir constantly. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1b/Toffeetart13.png/460px-Toffeetart13.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/1/1b/Toffeetart13.png/220px-Toffeetart13.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":228,"bigWidth":"220","bigHeight":"109","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart

"}Pour the cream and into the pan next. Mix it in well with the wooden spoon. Stir constantly. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/8/8e/Toffeetart14.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/8/8e/Toffeetart14.png/222px-Toffeetart14.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":385,"bigWidth":"222","bigHeight":"186","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart

"}Then stir the nuts into the sauce, making sure that they are completely covered with sauce. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/85/Toffeetart15.png/460px-Toffeetart15.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/8/85/Toffeetart15.png/220px-Toffeetart15.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":228,"bigWidth":"220","bigHeight":"109","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart

"}Continue to cook and stir until the sauce has reduced, but still retains moisture.

steps.headline: Prepare and make the tart.
steps.description:
{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/e/ec/Toffeetart16.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/e/ec/Toffeetart16.png/221px-Toffeetart16.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":393,"bigWidth":"221","bigHeight":"189","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart

"}Remove the beans and paper from the cooked pastry. The beans can be stored for using another time. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/d/dc/Toffeetart17.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/d/dc/Toffeetart17.png/222px-Toffeetart17.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":398,"bigWidth":"222","bigHeight":"192","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart

"}Pour the toffee nut sauce into the pre-baked crust. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0c/Toffeetart18.png/460px-Toffeetart18.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/0/0c/Toffeetart18.png/220px-Toffeetart18.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":224,"bigWidth":"220","bigHeight":"107","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart

"}Spread it evenly around. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/2d/Toffeetart19.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/2/2d/Toffeetart19.png/220px-Toffeetart19.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":385,"bigWidth":"220","bigHeight":"184","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart

"}Sprinkle a little salt over the toffee.

steps.headline: Place the tart in the refrigerator to cool.
steps.description: When the toffee cools, it will begin to solidify and be easier to cut.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Once cooled, it is ready to serve.

text:
Preheat the oven to 350ºF, 180ºC, or gas mark 4. Prepare the crust. Lay the shortcrust pastry over the tart tin and carefully press it down while molding it around the tin with your fingers, ensuring that it overlaps the sides by 0.19"/⁄2 centimeter (0.2 in). {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/56/Toffeetart4.png/456px-Toffeetart4.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/5/56/Toffeetart4.png/220px-Toffeetart4.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":117,"bigWidth":"220","bigHeight":"56","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart

"}Press down around the edges with your fingers. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/f1/Toffeetart5.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/f/f1/Toffeetart5.png/220px-Toffeetart5.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":422,"bigWidth":"220","bigHeight":"202","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart

"}Then carefully tear off the excess crust that hangs off. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/99/Toffeetart6.png/459px-Toffeetart6.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/9/99/Toffeetart6.png/222px-Toffeetart6.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":197,"bigWidth":"222","bigHeight":"95","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart

"}Use a fork to gently make holes on the bottom of the dough. This makes sure that the pastry doesn't rise while in the oven. Blind bake the pastry. Take the parchment paper and place it over the crust tin. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/3/3d/Toffeetart8.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/3/3d/Toffeetart8.png/220px-Toffeetart8.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":284,"bigWidth":"220","bigHeight":"136","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart

"}Pour the beans into the tin. The beans help to weigh down the pastry. Note that the dough is much better if it is cold before baking. Place the filled tin in the fridge or freezer for a few minutes to cool before baking. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fc/Toffeetart9.png/460px-Toffeetart9.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/f/fc/Toffeetart9.png/220px-Toffeetart9.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":220,"bigWidth":"220","bigHeight":"105","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart

"}Bake the crust for 20 to 25 minutes. Place it in the center of the oven. Remove from the oven when it's a light golden brown color. Prepare the toffee and nut filling. Place a pan on a medium heat. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/6/69/Toffeetart11.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/6/69/Toffeetart11.png/220px-Toffeetart11.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":332,"bigWidth":"220","bigHeight":"159","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart

"}Add the sugar to the pan and let it caramelize. When it begins the caramelizing process, stir the sugar with a wooden spoon to avoid any burning in one spot. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/1/15/Toffeetart12.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/1/15/Toffeetart12.png/221px-Toffeetart12.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":329,"bigWidth":"221","bigHeight":"158","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart

"}As soon as the sugar has caramelized, carefully add the butter - avoid getting splashed and continue to stir constantly. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1b/Toffeetart13.png/460px-Toffeetart13.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/1/1b/Toffeetart13.png/220px-Toffeetart13.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":228,"bigWidth":"220","bigHeight":"109","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart

"}Pour the cream and into the pan next. Mix it in well with the wooden spoon. Stir constantly. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/8/8e/Toffeetart14.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/8/8e/Toffeetart14.png/222px-Toffeetart14.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":385,"bigWidth":"222","bigHeight":"186","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart

"}Then stir the nuts into the sauce, making sure that they are completely covered with sauce. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/85/Toffeetart15.png/460px-Toffeetart15.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/8/85/Toffeetart15.png/220px-Toffeetart15.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":228,"bigWidth":"220","bigHeight":"109","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart

"}Continue to cook and stir until the sauce has reduced, but still retains moisture. Prepare and make the tart. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/e/ec/Toffeetart16.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/e/ec/Toffeetart16.png/221px-Toffeetart16.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":393,"bigWidth":"221","bigHeight":"189","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart

"}Remove the beans and paper from the cooked pastry. The beans can be stored for using another time. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/d/dc/Toffeetart17.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/d/dc/Toffeetart17.png/222px-Toffeetart17.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":398,"bigWidth":"222","bigHeight":"192","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart

"}Pour the toffee nut sauce into the pre-baked crust. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0c/Toffeetart18.png/460px-Toffeetart18.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/0/0c/Toffeetart18.png/220px-Toffeetart18.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":224,"bigWidth":"220","bigHeight":"107","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart

"}Spread it evenly around. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/2d/Toffeetart19.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/2/2d/Toffeetart19.png/220px-Toffeetart19.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":385,"bigWidth":"220","bigHeight":"184","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-mixed-nut-toffee-tart

"}Sprinkle a little salt over the toffee. Place the tart in the refrigerator to cool. When the toffee cools, it will begin to solidify and be easier to cut. Serve. Once cooled, it is ready to serve.
